transliteration: Baajat Taalan|| Naachat Baalan|| Gadvat Geethan|| Aanand Saathan||20||
translation: The young damsels were dancing and were singing happily while clapping their hands.20.

transliteration: Kokil Baidee|| Soundar Nainee|| Gadvat Geetan|| Chorat Cheetan||21||
translation: These women of the voice of a nightingale and having beautiful eyes, were alluring the mind by singing the song.21.

transliteration: Achhran Bhesee|| Soundar Kesee|| Soundar Nainee|| Kokil Bainee||22||
translation: These women having beautiful hair, charming eyes and in the garb of heavenly damsels had the voice of a nightingale.22.

transliteration: Atbhout Roopaa|| Kaamanndkoopaa|| Chaar Prahaasan|| Ounnit Naasan||23||
translation: These women had marvelous figures, full of desires, with bewitching smiles and long nostrils.23.

gurmukhi: liK duiq rwxI ]lijq ieMdRwxI ]sohq bwlw ]rwgx mwlw ]24]
transliteration: Lakh(i) Dout(i) Raanee|| Lajit Indraanee|| Sohat Baalaa|| Raagad Maalaa||24||
translation: Seeing the beauty of the queens, the wife of Indra also felt shy; these heavenly maidens were like the rosary of musical modes.24.

gurmukhi: gaur srUp mhw Cib sohq ]doKq sur nr ko mn mohq ]rIJq qwik bfy niRp AYsy ]soBih kaun skY kih qYsy ]25]
transliteration: Gaddd Saroop Mahaa Chhab(i) Sohat|| Dekhat Sur Nark O Man Mohar|| Reejhat Taak(i) Bade Nrip Aise|| Sobhah(i) Kaoun Sakai Kah(i) Taise||25||
translation: These whit-complexioned elegant women were fascinating the mind of gods and men; seeing them, the great kings got pleased; what more description can be given of their glory?.25.

gurmukhi: suMdr rUp duiq bwlIX ]pyKq rIJq bIr irswlIX ]nwcq Bwv Anyk qRIAw kr ]dyKq soBw rIJq sur nr ]26]
transliteration: Sueedar Roop Mahaa Dout(i) Baaleeya|| Pekhat Reejhat Beer Risaaleeya|| Naachat Bhaav Anek Treeyaa Kar|| Dekhat Sobhaa Reejhat Sur Nar||26||
translation: Seeing the embellishment of these women, many men of taste were getting pleased; the women were dancing in many emotional postures, seeing which all the gods and men were delighted.26.

gurmukhi: ihMsq hYvr icMsq hwQIX ]nwcq nwgr gwvq gwQIX ]rIJq sur nr mohq rwjw ]dyvq dwn durMq smwjw ]27]
transliteration: Hinsat Haivar Chinsat Haathiya|| Naachat Naagad Gadvat Gaddheeya|| Reejhat Sur Nar Mohat Raajaa|| Devat Daan Durant Samaajaa||27||
translation: The horses were neighing; the elephants were trumpeting and the people of the town were dancing; the gods, men and women were all getting pleased and the kings were busy in bestowing charities.27.

gurmukhi: gwvq gIqn ncq Ap`Crw ]rIJq rwjw KIJq A`Crw ]bwjq nwrd bIn rswlIX ]dyKq dyv pRBwsq j√çwlIX ]28]
transliteration: Gadvat Geetan Nachat Apachchharaa|| Reejhat Raajaa Kheejhat Achchharaa|| Baajat Naarad Been Rasaaleeya|| Dekhat Dev Prabhaasat Jvaaleeya||28||
translation: The heavenly damsels were dancing while singing, seeing whom, the kings got pleased and their queens were also getting angry; the pretty lyre of Narada was being played, seeing which the gods seemed radiant like fire.28.

gurmukhi: AwNjq AMjn swjq AMgw ]soBq bsqR su AMg surMg ]nwcq ACRI rIJq rwaU ]cwhq brbo krq aupwaU ]29]
transliteration: Aanjat Anjan Saajat Anad|| Sobhat Bastra Su An Suranad|| Naachat Achharireejhat Raaoo|| Chaahat Barbo Karat Oupaaoo||29||
translation: All of them had put antimony in their eyes and had bedecked their limbs, having worn handsome garments; the kings were getting pleased and were trying to wed them.29.

gurmukhi: qq QeI nwcY srpur bwlw ]rux Jux bwjY rMg AMg mwlw ]bin bin bYTy j`h q`h rwjw ]dY dY fwrY qn mn swjw ]30]
transliteration: Tat Thainaachai Sarpur Baalaa|| Roun Jhoon Baajai Ran An Maalaa|| Ban(i) Ban(i) Baithe Jahh Tahh Raajaa|| Dai Dai Ddarai Tan Man Saajaa||30||
translation: The women of gods were dancing and the jingling of the rosaries of their limbs was being heard; the kings were sitting with pomp and show at various places.30.

gurmukhi: ijh ijh dyK so so rIJw ]ijn nhI dyKw iqn mn KIJw ]kir kir BwXM qRIA br nwcYN ]AqBuq BwXM AMg AMg rwcYN ]31]
transliteration: Jih Jih Dekh So So Reejhaa|| Jin Nahidekhaa Tin Man Kheejhaa|| Kar(i) Kar(i) Bhaayan|| Treea Bar Naachain|| Abhout Bhaayan An An Raachain||31||
translation: Whosoever saw this, he was pleased and he who did not see this, he got angry in his mind; the women were dancing, exhibiting various kinds of emotions and there was wonderful emotional play from every limb of theirs.31.

gurmukhi: iqn AqBuq gq jh qh TwnI ]jh qh sohY mun mn mwnI ]qij qij jogM Bij Bij AwvYN ]liK Aiq AwBw jIA suK pwvYN ]32]
transliteration: Tin Atbhout Gad Jah Tah Thaanee|| Jah Tah Sohai Mounndman Maanee|| Taj(i) Taj(i) Jouang|| Bhaj(i) Bhaj(i) Aavain|| Lakh(i) At(i) Aabhaa Jeea Souch Paavain||32||
translation: Those women also decided to do something marvelous at that place, because there were sitting there some persistent sages; the Yogis leaving their meditation came running and seeing the glory of this function, they were pleased.32.
